title: Trump says space force general will lead Golden Dome missile defense project – US politics live
snippets:
Funding for Trump’s missile defense shield idea to protect the US from long-range strikes included in tax bill facing opposition from some Republicans

These are challenging days for Florida governor Ron DeSantis, the man who would have been king. Barely two and a half years since his landslide re-election and anointment as “DeFuture” of the Republican party in a fawning New York Post cover, he stands isolated from the national political stage, feuding with his once blindingly loyal Florida legislature, and limping towards the finish line of his second term with an uncertain pathway beyond.

It has been, in the view of many analysts, a fall of stunning velocity and magnitude. And while few are willing to completely rule out a comeback for a 46-year-old politician who was the darling of the Republican hard right until he dared to challenge Donald Trump for his party’s 2024 presidential nomination, it is also clear that everything has changed.

He’s lost the ability to push things through. He’s lost that luster he had that at one time seemed like he could do no wrong in Republican conservative circles. He’s definitely come back down to earth and some of it is his own doing because if you govern with an autocratic style, that doesn’t usually make you a lot of allies.

Continue reading...
titles: Trump says space force general will lead Golden Dome missile defense project – US politics live
summary: Funding for a missile defense shield proposed by Trump is included in a tax bill currently facing opposition from some Republicans. Meanwhile, Florida Governor Ron DeSantis, once celebrated as a rising star within the party, is experiencing significant political challenges. After a rapid rise and a landslide re-election, DeSantis is now estranged from the national political stage and his state's legislature, with his future uncertain. Analysts note his diminished influence and speculate on his potential for a comeback, highlighting the consequences of his governance style.
constructiveness_reason: This story provides useful context about the political landscape, including the challenges faced by Florida Governor Ron DeSantis and the proposed missile defense shield. It informs readers about the current state of US politics, but it does not focus on solutions or improvements, nor does it empower readers with actionable insights.

title: U.S. Bill Named for Artemis Ghasemzadeh Aims to Shield Asylum Seekers
snippets: A lawmaker is introducing a bill named for Artemis Ghasemzadeh, an Iranian Christian convert, that seeks to stop the expedited removal of people fleeing countries that persecute religious minorities.
titles: U.S. Bill Named for Artemis Ghasemzadeh Aims to Shield Asylum Seekers
summary: A lawmaker has proposed a bill named after Artemis Ghasemzadeh, an Iranian Christian convert, aiming to prevent the fast-track deportation of individuals escaping from nations known for persecuting religious minorities. This legislative effort seeks to offer protection to those facing persecution on the basis of their religious beliefs, ensuring they have a chance to seek refuge and safety.
constructiveness_reason: This story is constructive as it provides useful information about a proposed bill aiming to protect asylum seekers from fast-track deportation. This story highlights a potential solution to a problem, thus empowering readers with knowledge about efforts to improve the situation of persecuted religious minorities.

title: Tesla and xAI Plan to Keep Buying Chips From Nvidia and AMD, Musk Says
snippets:
Key Takeaways

  • Elon Musk expects Tesla and xAI to continue buying chips from Nvidia and Advanced Micro Devices, the CEO said in an interview with CNBC Tuesday.
  • Musk said xAI is planning to build a facility near Memphis that will house 1 million GPUs.
  • Meanwhile, Tesla requires “quite a few” GPUs to train its Optimus humanoid robots, the CEO said.


Elon Musk expects Tesla (TSLA) and xAI to continue buying chips from Nvidia (NVDA) and Advanced Micro Devices (AMD), the CEO said in an interview with CNBC Tuesday.

Musk said xAI, the company behind the Grok large language model, plans to build a facility near Memphis that will house 1 million GPUs. The X platform parent has already installed 200,000 chips at an existing facility in the area, Musk said. 

Meanwhile, Tesla needs “quite a few” GPUs for training its Optimus humanoid robots, Musk said. “We expect to still buy a lot of GPUs from Nvidia, some from AMD, and maybe from others,” Musk said. “So long as Nvidia is better than what we make, we'll keep buying from Nvidia.”

Nvidia, which saw its shares surge over the past week after announcing a major deal to supply chips to Saudi AI startup Humain, is due to report earnings next week. Shares of AMD and Tesla had also rallied last week amid optimism that a series of AI partnerships announced during President Donald Trump's four-day trip to the Middle East could mean more deals to come.

In a separate interview Tuesday, Musk told attendees of the Qatar Economic Forum he remains committed to being CEO of the electric vehicle maker for at least the next five years.

Shares of Tesla, AMD, and Nvidia were little-changed in after-hours trading, after Tesla eked out a 0.5% gain during Tuesday's regular session, while AMD and Nvidia lost about 1%.
titles: Tesla and xAI Plan to Keep Buying Chips From Nvidia and AMD, Musk Says
summary: Elon Musk announced plans for xAI, a company linked to the X platform, to construct a facility near Memphis to accommodate 1 million GPUs, complementing the 200,000 already installed in the area. This development is part of a broader strategy where Tesla and xAI will continue purchasing chips from Nvidia and Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) to support projects, including Tesla's Optimus humanoid robots. Musk emphasized the ongoing need for Nvidia's GPUs, citing their superiority for Tesla's requirements. Meanwhile, shares of Tesla, AMD, and Nvidia showed minimal changes in after-hours trading, fol
constructiveness_reason: This story is highly constructive as it provides useful insights into the strategies of Tesla and xAI, and their continued reliance on Nvidia and AMD chips. It also reports on the progress of these companies in terms of infrastructure development and project support. It increases awareness around the trends in the tech industry and the impacts of these strategies on the market.

title: Watch These Strategy Price Levels as Stock Continues to Surge Alongside Bitcoin
snippets:
Key Takeaways

  • Shares of Strategy, the world's largest corporate holder of bitcoin, have soared 75% from their April low, tracking a recovery in the cryptocurrency and other risk-on assets. 
  • The stock has climbed back toward its record high following a retracement to the 50-day moving average in March.
  • Investors should watch key overhead areas on Strategy's chart around $440 and $945, while also monitoring crucial support levels near $230 and $180.


Shares of Strategy (MSTR), the world's largest corporate holder of bitcoin that until recently was known as MicroStrategy, rose again Tuesday as the digital currency continued rising.

The stock, which provides investors with a leverage bet on bitcoin's price, had gotten a boost to start the week after the company announced its latest purchase of the cryptocurrency. According to a regulatory filing on Monday, Strategy purchased 7,390 bitcoin between May 12 and 18, taking its total holding to 576,230 BTC, currently worth more about $61 billion based on bitcoin's recent price.

Strategy shares have soared 75% from their April low, tracking a recovery in the price of bitcoin and other risk-on assets as investor concerns about global trade tensions and their potential economic impact have subsided. Bitcoin surged above $107,000 on Tuesday, hitting its highest level since January and approaching its record high of just over $109,000.

Below, we take a closer look at Strategy’s weekly chart and apply technical analysis to point out key price levels that investors will likely be watching.

Record High Remains in Focus

Since the 50-day moving average (MA) crossed above the 200-day MA in January last year to form a bullish golden cross pattern, Strategy shares have continued to trend sharply higher. 

More recently, the stock has climbed back toward its record high throughout April and May following a retracement to the 50-day MA in March. However, it's worth noting this move has occurred on significantly less trading volume than the two most prior uptrends, indicating that larger market participants may remain on the sidelines.

Let’s identify two key overhead areas on Strategy’s chart to watch if the shares continue their bullish move, while also locating crucial support levels worth monitoring during corrections.

Key Overhead Areas to Watch

A move higher from current levels could bring the $440 level into play. This area may provide overhead resistance near a brief consolidation period that developed on the chart shortly after the stock set its record high last November.

To forecast an overhead area to watch if the shares move into price discovery mode, investors can use the bars pattern tool. We apply this technique by taking the price bars from the stock’s trending move from September to November and reposition them from the start of the current uptrend. This analysis, which predicts how a move higher may play out if price action rhymes, projects an upside target of around $945.

Crucial Support Levels Worth Monitoring

During a correction in the stock, investors should initially monitor the $230 level. This location on the chart could attract buying interest near the February and March troughs, and also closely aligns with a slight pause in the stock’s uptrend during late October.

Finally, a more significant drop could see Strategy shares test lower support around $180. Investors may may look to place buy limit orders in this region near a trendline that links three peaks that formed on the chart between March and July last year.

The comments, opinions, and analyses expressed on Investopedia are for informational purposes only. Read our warranty and liability disclaimer for more info.

As of the date this article was written, the author does not own any of the above securities.
titles: Watch These Strategy Price Levels as Stock Continues to Surge Alongside Bitcoin
summary: Shares of Strategy (formerly known as MicroStrategy), the world's largest corporate holder of bitcoin, have seen a significant increase, rising 75% from their April low. This surge aligns with the recovery of bitcoin and other risk-on assets, with Strategy's stock climbing back toward its record high. The company recently boosted its bitcoin holdings by purchasing an additional 7,390 BTC, bringing its total to 576,230 BTC, valued at about $61 billion. Investors are advised to watch for key resistance levels at $440 and $945, and support levels at $230 and $180, as these could indicate future p

title: Galaxy Clusters Should Be Cold – XRISM Just Found Out Why They’re Not
snippets: Astronomers may have finally cracked one of the universe’s long-standing puzzles: why galaxy clusters remain mysteriously warm despite constantly losing energy through X-rays. Using Japan’s XRISM satellite, scientists observed a fast, swirling flow of superheated gas in the Centaurus cluster. This gentle but powerful motion appears to redistribute heat throughout the cluster, acting like a [...]
titles: Galaxy Clusters Should Be Cold – XRISM Just Found Out Why They’re Not
summary: Astronomers have discovered why galaxy clusters stay warm, solving a long-standing cosmic mystery. Using Japan's XRISM satellite, they observed a fast, swirling flow of superheated gas in the Centaurus cluster. This motion redistributes heat throughout the cluster, preventing it from cooling down despite losing energy through X-rays.
constructiveness_reason: The story clearly highlights a scientific breakthrough, offering empowering knowledge about the universe. It provides a deeper understanding of galaxy clusters, solving a long-standing cosmic mystery. This information can be useful for those interested in astronomy or the natural sciences.

title: NASA’s Perseverance Snaps Rare, Eerie View of Mars’ Tiny Moon Before Sunrise

titles: NASA’s Perseverance Snaps Rare, Eerie View of Mars’ Tiny Moon Before Sunrise
summary: NASA's Perseverance rover captured a rare and striking image of Deimos, Mars' smaller moon, using a long-exposure technique. This image, made from 16 stitched photos, shows Deimos rising in the pre-dawn sky on Mars at 4:27 a.m. local time on March 1, 2025. The photo offers a hauntingly beautiful view of the tiny moon, showcasing NASA's ongoing exploration and study of Mars and its celestial surroundings.
constructiveness_reason: While this story offers a fascinating glimpse into space exploration, its constructive value is somewhat limited. title: On the origin (and fate) of plants that never bloom
snippets: Plants that reproduce exclusively by self-pollination arise from populations with extremely low diversity to begin with. Kobe University research not only adds a facet to possible evolutionary strategies, but also lends weight to Darwin's suspicion that this strategy might be a path to extinction.
titles: On the origin (and fate) of plants that never bloom
summary: Kobe University research found that plants which reproduce only through self-pollination originate from populations with very low diversity. This discovery supports Charles Darwin's theory that such reproductive strategies could lead to extinction, providing new insight into evolutionary strategies.
constructiveness_reason: This story is highly constructive. It provides a deeper understanding of plant evolution and reproduction, supporting a theory proposed by Charles Darwin. This knowledge could be useful for botanists, ecologists, and the general public interested in biology. It also indirectly highlights the importance of biodiversity for the survival of species.
